_metadata.course_description: The objective of this course is to give students a basic grounding in designing and implementing distributed and cloud systems.
learning_outcomes: Develop distributed and Web services, using programming paradigms such as client-server, streaming, peer-to-peer, event-driven, and REST.

Explain protocols for achieving agreement in distributed systems, such as Two Phase Commit (2PC) and Paxos, and explain their application in scenarios such as transactional e-commerce and cloud infrastructure.
Explain methods for building highly available services, and explain the trade-off between weak and strong consistency as given in the CAP theorem.
Develop cloud applications using frameworks such as Cassandra, Hadoop, Pig, and Hive.
Describe implementation methods and protocols for distributed storage systems: distributed file systems, distributed hash tables, cloud storage, and NoSQL databases.
prerequisites: You are expected to have a certain amount of programming maturity, since you will be developing distributed programs during the course of the term.
You should know Java since that will be the language for the assignments.
